revision.text:
The Safari Zone is a zone where the player may spend 100 Quest Points to try and catch unique Pokémon. Some Pokémon, like in the original games, only appear in the Safari Zone. The player has 30 Safari Balls and an option to either catch, throw a rock, bait the Pokémon or flee.
==Pokemon== {| class="wikitable sortable" style |- ! Pokémon !! Encounter Chance |- | Nidorina || 9.04% |- | Nidorina(M) || 6.02% |- | Nidorino(M)|| 15.06% |- | Nidorino || 6.02% |- | Exeggcute || 12.05% |- | Paras || 3.01% |- | Parasect || 9.04% |- | Rhyhorn || 9.04% |- | Chansey || 2.41% |- | Scyther || 2.41% |- | Pinsir || 2.41% |- | Kangaskhan || 9.04% |- | Taurous || 6.02% |- | Cubone || 6.02% |- | Marowak || 3.01% |- | Tangela|| 2.41% |}

==The Safari Zone== The Safari Zone is a zone where the player may spend 100 Quest Points to try and catch Unique pokemon. Some pokemon, like in the original games, only appear in the safari zone. The player has 30 Safari Balls and an option to either bait, run, or flee.
==Pokemon== {| class="wikitable sortable" style |- ! Pokemon !!
